intro: Calcitrapa altissima, commonly known as the tall false bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. The plant features erect, branching stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its showy blue or violet flowers are clustered in racemes, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
